intro: Lotononis quinata var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is popular among gardeners interested in native and drought-tolerant plants.
